item.title: Can Claude Opus 4.1 Be Secured for Enterprise Use? Our Red Teaming Results
item.description: Claude Opus 4.1 demonstrates strong capabilities in long-context reasoning and coding tasks, achieving a 74.5% SWE-bench score. However, its default security posture is insufficient for enterprise use, with significant improvements only realized through SPLX's prompt hardening, which boosts security to 87.61% and safety to 99.66%. Rigorous AI red teaming and prompt hardening are essential to mitigate risks and ensure reliable, secure deployment in production environments.

item.title: SPLX and COONTEC Partner to Secure Enterprise AI in South Korea
item.description: SPLX has partnered with South Korean cybersecurity leader COONTEC to distribute its AI Security Posture Management platform, enhancing secure AI adoption for enterprises in the region. The collaboration leverages SPLX's end-to-end AI security capabilities and COONTEC's expertise in AI supply chain and cybersecurity across multiple industries. This partnership aims to address emerging AI-specific security threats and support large-scale, secure deployment of AI systems.
